paragraphs.text: The real threat to the Indian state.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: India projects itself as a target of Islamic terrorism perpetrated by home- grown Indian Mujahideen (IM) or Pakistan-based outfits particularly in India- administered Kashmir
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: essentially to garner sympathy internationally and unite the population
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The truth, however, is that many armed groups like the Maoist uprising in the "Red Corridor" and the secessionist rebellion in the north-east pose a graver challenge to the Indian state than bombings and sporadic terrorist strikes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which New Delhi touts to validate its vulnerability-cum-victimhood narrative before the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The latest Global Terrorism Index released by international think tank Institute of Economics and Peace reveals that while jihadists were responsible for 15 percent of terrorism-related killings in India; Maoists accounted for the lion's share of casualties - a whopping 50 percent - in 2013
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The remaining 35 percent of deaths were caused by guerillas fighting for statehood or independence in states like Assam, Manipur and Nagaland
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Armed group, the National Democratic Front of Bodoland (NDFB), which gunned down 75 Adivasis, or tribespeople, just before Christmas in its diabolical pursuit of a separate homeland for ethnic Bodos in Assam, was on the government's radar for a long time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The carnage provoked an uncompromising crackdown by the Indian army but thereby hangs a grim tale of political expediency
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Syed Asif Ibrahim, Intelligence Bureau director, seemed to have a premonition of the massacre
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He pointed out that NDFB has become one of the deadliest separatist outfits in business at the IB's 49th annual conference in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Interior Minister Rajnath Singh in Assam's largest city, Guwahati, last month
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He observed that one option before the government was to bring NDFB to the negotiating table
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: At present, though, negotiations are out of the question
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "How can you hold talks with terrorists who thrust a gun into a five-month-old baby's mouth?" the interior minister said at a press conference even, as he dispatched army chief General Dalbir Singh Suhag to capture the killers and smash the group's network
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Singh could well have cited another instance of sheer savagery - a seven-year- old boy was shot seven times in his foot, thigh, abdomen, hand and face - to build a stronger case for the clampdown
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which surprised many
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Clearly, lightning action by the Bharatiya Janata Party-led federal government was in sharp contrast to the nationalist party's known stand on Bodo violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The BJP didn't shed tears
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: NDFB shot dead 50 Bengali-speaking Muslims in May
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But the party's own poll campaign then underway accused Bangladeshi Muslims of"destroying" India
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So the killings jelled with the BJP's political rhetoric; just days before the May butchery
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Modi declared that Bangladeshis must keep their "bags packed" for deportation if he captured power
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Similarly
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: NDFB slaughtered nearly a 100 Muslims and displaced half a million in July-August 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: senior BJP leader Lal Krishna Advani immediately extended moral support to the Bodos
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He publicly argued that the blood-bath was the result of a silent Bangladeshi demographic invasion straining resources and creating insecurity among Bodos
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The party also organised a seminar in New Delhi on "Bodo Hindus - Refugees in their own land: Bangladeshi Muslim infiltrators - the new kingmakers in an Indian state" with then BJP president, Nitin Gadkari, as a key speaker
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: decoding the BJP's somersault is pretty easy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: NDFB killing Muslims and forcing terrified survivors into hellish refugee camps was par for the course as far as BJP was concerned
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: training their guns on Adivasis was a blunder NDFB will regret for a long time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The BJP immediately let loose the army on NDFB to repay a big debt of gratitude and regain Adivasi goodwill crucial for wresting Assam from the Congress Party in the 2016 state assembly elections
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Adivasis, who account for almost 20 percent of Assam's voters, ditched the Congress Party in this year's parliamentary elections and supported the BJP giving the party seven seats compared to four in 2009
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The party's Adivasi candidates, Rameshwar Teli and Kamakhya Prasad Tasa, trounced Congress MPs in Dibrugarh and Jorhat
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The BJP's vote-share rose to 36.6 percent from 16.21 percent thanks to Adivasis
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: which also explains the BJP's muscular response to the December 23 massacre
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a sense Bodos were tempting fate for a long time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They constitute barely six percent of Assam's 33 million population but want half of the state for themselves
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: They chose the path of terror way back in 1987 with the slogan "Divide Assam 50-50" leaving behind a trail of murder and mayhem
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The first tripartite peace treaty between the federal government, state government and Bodos was signed in 1993
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it collapsed under the weight of its own contradictions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Another accord signed in 2003 resulted in the Bodo Territorial Autonomous District (BTAD) giving them considerable autonomy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: BTAD covering around 8,795 square-km area was given to Bodos on a platter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: although they comprised only 20 percent of the population in BTAD
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The rest are predominantly Muslims - many of whom are migrants from Bangladesh- and Adivasis
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Bodos floated a political party called Bodoland People's Front (BPF) to administer BTAD
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: armed groups, such as Bodo Liberation Tigers (BLT) and NDFB with their extremist-supremacist agenda, called the shots
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was a bizarre case of 20 percent ruling over 80 percent!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because Bodos didn't enjoy numerical majority
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they resorted to ethnic cleansing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whether their targets were Muslims or Adivasis, Bodos invariably inflicted more casualties than they suffered primarily
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because they didn't surrender their arms
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as they were supposed to after the 2003 accord
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now the army's brief is to defang NDFB by snatching their guns before eliminating them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The political motive behind the crackdown is crystal clear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even otherwise, Singh, the interior minister, is increasingly realising the consequences of armed groups having a free run
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Earlier this month he flew to Raipur, capital of Chattisgarh state
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: after Maoists killed 14 Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) soldiers in cold blood
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Singh wanted to visit the ambush site about 450km from Raipur
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But security forces warned him that Maoists were capable of bringing down his helicopter!
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So Singh couldn't make his way to the blood-soaked Ground Zero literally in the centre of India - a sad commentary on a nuclear nation's internal security scenario
paragraphs.label: assumption
